feed.title: COALAB Laboratory
feed.subtitle: Cognition, Oral & Written Language Disorders, and AI Laboratory - Focusing on language disorders through speech-language pathology, developmental neuroscience, and artificial intelligence

entry.title: New Research Grant Awarded
entry.content:
COALAB has been awarded a $1.2M NSF grant to study bilingual language processing in children with developmental language disorders.

This five-year project will allow us to:

  1. Conduct large-scale longitudinal studies
  2. Develop new assessment tools
  3. Collaborate with local schools and clinics

We are excited to embark on this important work!
entry.summary: COALAB has been awarded a $1.2M NSF grant to study bilingual language processing in children with developmental language disorders.

entry.title: Paper Accepted at ACL 2025
entry.content:
Our paper “Cross-Linguistic Transfer in Multilingual Language Models” has been accepted for publication at ACL 2025.

Abstract: We present a comprehensive analysis of cross-linguistic transfer in state-of-the-art multilingual models. Our results show that…

The paper will be presented by lead author Dr. Sarah Johnson at the conference in June.
entry.summary: Our paper "Cross-Linguistic Transfer in Multilingual Language Models" has been accepted for publication at ACL 2025.

entry.title: New Lab Members Join
entry.content:
Welcome to our new postdoctoral researcher Dr. Maria Chen and two new PhD students joining the COALAB team this fall.

Dr. Maria Chen joins us from UC Berkeley, where she completed her PhD in Cognitive Science. Her work focuses on semantic representation.

New PhD Students:

  • Lisa Zhang (Linguistics)
  • Michael Brown (Computer Science)

We are thrilled to have them on board!
entry.summary: Welcome to our new postdoctoral researcher Dr. Maria Chen and two new PhD students joining the COALAB team this fall.
